summary: Progressive Web App (PWA) video streaming platform named Saanufox with YouTube integration, supporting mobile and desktop browsers, home screen installation, and offline functionality
architectural_notes: Video streaming application similar to Netflix
User authentication system needed for accounts
Public video upload access - all users can upload content
Progressive Web App (PWA) architecture with service workers
Offline-first design with content caching strategy
Home screen installable on mobile and desktop browsers
Responsive design optimized for mobile and desktop viewports
known_issues: YouTube videos are not displaying correctly
Video uploading system is not functioning properly
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Saanufox app icon with modern streaming theme in red and black colors suitable for PWA (pwa-icon-192.dim_192x192.png)
- Saanufox app icon with modern streaming theme in red and black colors suitable for PWA high resolution (pwa-icon-512.dim_512x512.png)
- Apple touch icon for iOS home screen with Saanufox branding (apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png)

existing_features.title: Create a video library browsing interface displaying video thumbnails in a grid layout with title and metadata
Implement video playback functionality allowing users to play selected videos
Add search functionality enabling users to find videos by title or keywords
Organize videos into categories and genres with navigation between them
Implement user authentication system using Internet Identity for account management
Create favorites and watchlist functionality allowing users to save and manage their preferred videos
Design a cohesive streaming platform visual theme with cinematic dark colors, elegant typography, and modern layout patterns that emphasize video content
Display generated thumbnail images for video library as static assets in frontend/public/assets/generated
Update VideoPlayer component to detect and render YouTube videos using an iframe embed when the video source is a YouTube URL, while maintaining existing HTML5 video player for blob-based videos
Create an admin video upload form that allows adding videos either by uploading a file blob or by providing a YouTube video URL, with fields for title, description, category, genre, and keywords
Add a prominent 'Upload Video' button or card in the Browse page hero section that navigates to the admin upload page when clicked
Display the upload section prominently in the main navigation or as a featured action on the Browse page so users can easily find where to add videos
Remove admin-only authorization check from the video upload page so any authenticated user can access the upload form and submit videos
Update the Layout navigation to show the Upload link to all authenticated users, not just admins
Display the Upload Video card on the Browse page hero section for all authenticated users, not just admins
Debug and fix the video upload system in the AdminUpload page to ensure videos can be successfully created with either YouTube URLs or file uploads
Check and fix the YouTube URL extraction and validation logic in youtubeHelpers.ts to ensure YouTube video IDs are correctly parsed from various URL formats

Create a manifest.json file in the frontend/public directory with app metadata including name 'Saanufox', short_name, description 'Modern video streaming platform', theme_color matching the dark cinematic theme, background_color, display mode 'standalone', start_url, and icons array with multiple sizes (192x192, 512x512) for home screen installation
Link the manifest.json file in frontend/index.html by adding a <link rel='manifest' href='/manifest.json'> tag in the <head> section
Add theme-color meta tag to frontend/index.html matching the manifest theme_color for consistent browser UI theming

Create a service worker file (sw.js) in frontend/public that implements caching strategies for offline support, including cache-first strategy for static assets (JS, CSS, images) and network-first strategy for API calls, with proper cache versioning and cleanup

Create an offline fallback page (offline.html) in frontend/public that displays when the user is offline and requests uncached content, with basic styling matching the app theme and a message indicating no internet connection
Add apple-touch-icon meta tags to frontend/index.html for iOS home screen installation support with appropriate icon sizes

new_feature_requests.summary: Add support for storing YouTube video URLs in the video metadata model alongside existing blob-based videos
Add backend mutation endpoint for creating videos that accepts either blob data or YouTube URL along with metadata, and stores them appropriately in the video collection
Generate thumbnail images automatically for YouTube videos by extracting them from YouTube's thumbnail API, and store them in the same manner as existing video thumbnails
Add visible upload section interface for adding YouTube videos and file uploads
Allow all users to upload videos (public upload access)
Remove admin-only authorization requirement from the backend createVideo endpoint so any authenticated user can create video entries
Investigate and fix the YouTube video rendering issue in the VideoPlayer component to ensure YouTube videos display correctly using the iframe embed when the video source is a YouTube URL
Verify that the backend createVideo endpoint correctly processes video creation requests from all authenticated users and stores video metadata properly
Convert Saanufox into a Progressive Web App (PWA) with manifest.json, service worker, and offline support
Enable home screen installation capability for mobile and desktop browsers
Implement offline functionality allowing cached content access without internet
Register the service worker in frontend/src/main.tsx after the React app mounts, with proper error handling and console logging for registration success/failure
